# Templates & Resources

Ready-to-use templates for all aspects of event planning, communications, and day-of operations.

## Quick Navigation

- **[Agendas](agendas.md)** — Full-day and half-day schedule templates
- **[Communications](communications.md)** — Social media kits and press releases
- **[Operations & Runbooks](operations.md)** — Day-of procedures and incident response
- **[Slides & Speaker Notes](slides.md)** — Presentation guidance and speaker resources

## Using Templates

**1. Copy** → Clone or download templates from this section  
**2. Customize** → Adapt for your city, dates, speakers, and focus areas  
**3. Review** → Check against [Event Standards](../planning/event-standards.md)  
**4. Finalize** → Get team feedback and publish  

## Template Categories

### Agendas
Flexible schedules for different event formats:
- Full-day (9 hours)
- Half-day (4 hours)
- Customization examples and best practices

### Communications
Everything you need to promote your event:
- Social media kit with hashtags and sample posts
- 4-week announcement calendar
- Press release template with customization tips

### Operations & Runbooks
Day-of procedures and incident management:
- Pre-event, during, and post-event checklists
- Contact and escalation matrix
- Incident brief template

### Slides & Speaker Notes
Guidance for presenters:
- Slide deck structure template
- Speaker notes with breakdown tables
- Accessibility checklist (contrast, fonts, alt text)
- Lab and demo guidance

## Best Practices

- **Start Early** — Copy templates 2-3 months before your event
- **Customize Thoroughly** — Make templates reflect your local context
- **Test Everything** — Run through agendas and operations with your team
- **Gather Feedback** — Share drafts with speakers and volunteers
- **Document Lessons** — Record what worked for future events
